body.p: To check whether a filesystem has labels on a partition, log on to the server and execute the xfs_admin command as follows (where /dev/sdc1 is the partition where the filesystem is located).sudo xfs_admin -l /dev/sdc1

The output shows if a filesystem has a label. For exampe, this shows a label of c0a8f502h000.$ sudo xfs_admin -l /dev/sdc1 label = "c0a8f502h000"If no filesystem exists, the result is similar as follows:$ sudo xfs_admin -l /dev/sde1 xfs_admin: /dev/sde is not a valid XFS filesystem (unexpected SB magic number 0x00000000)
In this example, /dev/sde1 does not have a filesystem label.
